alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 10:04PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Dickinson and Marquette Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Witch Lake. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water impacts the yards and a few homes near Bengtson bridge on County Road LI in South Republic and along Floodwood Drive near the Michigamme River east of M-95. Approximately 6 inches of water is covering portions of County Road LG northwest of M-95 * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:10 AM CDT Monday /11:10 AM EDT Monday/ the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:10 AM CDT Monday /11:10 AM EDT Monday/ was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.9 feet on 05/07/1975. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday afternoon at 115 PM CDT /215 PM EDT/.
